content:
I don‚Äôt have any of your personal preferences saved yet‚Äîonly my own ChatDO identity and operating principles are in memory. [M1]

## What I currently know üîé
- Stored memory describes ChatDO‚Äôs identity, transparency, and response style, not your tastes or habits. [M1]

## Help me learn your likes ‚úÖ
Reply to any of these and I‚Äôll remember them for future answers:
- Work: your role, tech stack, preferred tools/editors.
- Communication: concise vs. detailed, examples vs. summaries, tone.
- Decisions: speed vs. thoroughness, risk tolerance.
- Daily prefs: time zone, typical hours, meeting preferences.
- Media: favorite genres (books/podcasts/shows), learning style (video/text/hands-on).
- Food & drink: coffee/tea, dietary preferences, favorites.
- Misc: hobbies, exercise, travel preferences, pet peeves.

Example format:
- Communication: concise, bullets only
- Tech: TypeScript, React, Next.js, Postgres
- Time zone: PST, mornings best
- Media: summaries first, links optional

Once you share, I‚Äôll store and use them by default. [M1]
